item.title: 特朗普燃油经济性退步可能使汽车价格更低，但更高的油费将抵消节省的开支
item.description: 特朗普政府提议废除拜登时代的汽车燃油效率标准，这可能会为美国汽车制造商节省数百亿美元，并有可能降低美国汽车买家的前期购买成本。【原文：The Trump administration's proposal to roll back Biden-era vehicle fuel efficiency standards may save automakers in the U.S. tens of billions of dollars and potentially lower upfront purchase costs for American car buyers.】

item.title: 纽约联储称 11 月美国家庭个人财务担忧加剧
item.description: 纽约联储周一发布的一份报告显示，尽管美国家庭对未来通胀轨迹的预期保持稳定，但他们在11月份对自己当前和未来的财务状况更加悲观。【原文：U.S. households grew more downbeat on their current and future financial situations in November, even as their expectations for the future trajectory of inflation held steady, a New York Federal Reserve report released on Monday showed.】

item.title: 奥本海默将 2026 年标准普尔 500 指数的目标设定为 8,100 点，创下历史新高
item.description: 奥本海默资产管理公司（Oppenheimer Asset Management）周一将 2026 年底的 S&P 500 指数目标值定为 8100 点，是华尔街主要券商中最看好该指数的预测，理由是预期企业盈利强劲，美国经济将继续保持韧性。【原文：Oppenheimer Asset Management on Monday set a year-end 2026 target of 8,100 for the S&P 500 index , the most bullish forecast among major Wall Street brokerages, citing expectations of strong corporate earnings and continued resilience in the U.S. economy.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称软银、英伟达欲以 140 亿美元估值投资 Skild AI
item.description: 据知情人士透露，日本软银集团（SoftBank Group）和英伟达（Nvidia）正在洽谈投资 Skild AI 公司，此轮融资金额超过 10 亿美元，路透社看到的一份条款表显示，这家机器人基础模型制造商的估值可能在 140 亿美元左右。【原文：Japan's SoftBank Group and Nvidia are in talks to invest in Skild AI, in a more than $1 billion funding round that could value the maker of foundation models for robots at around $14 billion, according to sources and a term sheet seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 全球股票基金在美联储决议前吸引资金流入
item.description: 由于对美联储本周可能降息的预期提振了风险情绪，全球股票基金在截至12月3日的一周内吸引了大量资金流入。【原文：Global equity funds attracted significant inflows in the week through December 3 as expectations of a potential Federal Reserve rate cut this week boosted risk sentiment.】

item.title: 中国闪存制造商永磁科技公司就军方指定起诉美国
item.description: 中国顶级闪存芯片制造商扬子江存储科技股份有限公司（YMTC）起诉美国国防部，质疑美国国防部将该技术公司列入涉嫌与中国军方合作的实体名单的决定。【原文：China's top flash memory chipmaker Yangtze Memory Technologies Co (YMTC) has sued the U.S. Defense Department, challenging a decision to include the technology company on a list of entities allegedly working with Beijing’s military.】

item.title: 九个欧盟国家敦促对 "购买欧洲产品 "政策采取极为谨慎的态度
item.description: 他们对这些政策对价格、供应链和竞争的潜在影响表示担忧。【原文：They cited concerns over the policies' potential impact on prices, supply chains and competition.】

item.title: 即时查看：派拉蒙以 1,084 亿美元恶意竞购华纳兄弟发现公司
item.description: 派拉蒙天舞公司（Paramount Skydance）周一向华纳兄弟发现公司（Warner Bros Discovery WBD.O）发起了价值 1,084 亿美元的恶意竞购，希望借此破坏好莱坞电影公司与 Netflix 的交易，为建立一个媒体巨头以挑战流媒体巨头的主导地位做最后的努力。【原文：Paramount Skydance on Monday launched a hostile bid worth $108.4 billion for Warner Bros Discovery WBD.O, as it looks to scupper the Hollywood studio's deal with Netflix, in a last-ditch effort to create a media powerhouse that would challenge the dominance of the streaming giant.】

item.title: 派拉蒙以 1,084 亿美元恶意竞购华纳兄弟发现公司
item.description: 派拉蒙天舞公司对华纳兄弟 Discovery 发起了价值 1,084 亿美元的恶意竞购，对与 Netflix 的交易造成了影响，这是该公司为创建一家媒体巨头以挑战流媒体巨头的主导地位而做出的最后努力。【原文：Paramount Skydance launched a hostile bid worth $108.4 billion for Warner Bros Discovery, throwing a wrench into the deal with Netflix in a last-ditch effort to create a media powerhouse that would challenge the dominance of the streaming giant.】

item.title: 欧盟委员会批准玛氏 360 亿美元的凯拉诺瓦交易
item.description: 欧盟委员会周一表示，已批准糖果和零食巨头玛氏公司以 360 亿美元（360.00 亿美元）的价格收购品客薯片生产商凯兰诺华公司（Kellanova），此前，欧盟委员会曾于 6 月份以竞争问题为由对该收购案展开全面调查。【原文：The European Commission has approved a $36 billion ($36.00 billion) bid from candy and snacks giant Mars to acquire Pringles maker Kellanova , it said on Monday, after opening a full-scale investigation into the takeover in June, citing concerns over competition.】

item.title: 波音完成收购 Spirit AeroSystems，进行重大供应链调整
item.description: 波音公司周一表示，它已经完成了对美国精神航空系统公司（Spirit AeroSystems）价值 47 亿美元的收购，重新获得了全球最大的独立机翼和机身制造商的大部分股权。【原文：Boeing said on Monday it has closed its $4.7 billion takeover of Spirit AeroSystems , reacquiring the bulk of the world's largest independent wing and fuselage maker.】

item.title: 特朗普言论引发对 Netflix 与华纳兄弟 720 亿美元交易的质疑
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）警告市场份额问题，Netflix 以 720 亿美元收购华纳兄弟（Warner Bros）的交易导致华尔街分析师多次下调目标价，这凸显了该收购可能面临的严格审查。【原文：Netflix's $72 billion Warner Bros deal led to several price target cuts by Wall Street analysts as U.S. President Donald Trump warned of market-share concerns, underscoring the tough scrutiny that the acquisition is likely to face.】

item.title: 特朗普将发布命令创建国家人工智能规则
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周一表示，他将在本周签署一项行政命令，他说该命令将为人工智能制定一项单一的国家规则。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he would sign an executive order this week that he said would create a single national rule for artificial intelligence, which the industry has said is necessary to override disparate laws passed by U.S. states.】

item.title: 印度塔塔公司与英特尔签约，成为 140 亿美元芯片业务的首个主要客户
item.description: 印度塔塔电子公司已获得英特尔公司作为其即将建立的芯片设施的第一个潜在客户，这可能标志着这家美国芯片制造商对印度制造业的雄心充满信心。【原文：India's Tata Electronics has secured Intel as the first prospective customer for its upcoming chip facilities, potentially signalling the U.S. chipmaker's confidence in India's manufacturing ambitions.】

item.title: IBM以110亿美元收购Confluent，推动云计算发展
item.description: IBM周一表示，它将收购数据基础设施公司Confluent，交易价值110亿美元，从而加强其云计算产品，以利用人工智能驱动的需求热潮。【原文：IBM said on Monday it will buy data infrastructure company Confluent in a deal valued at $11 billion, ramping up its cloud-computing offerings to capitalize on an AI-driven demand boom.】

item.title: Mirum Pharma 将以高达 8.2 亿美元的价格收购 Bluejay Therapeutics
item.description: Mirum Pharmaceuticals 公司周一表示，它将收购 Bluejay Therapeutics 公司，交易金额高达 8.2 亿美元，为其产品组合增加了一种治疗严重肝病的晚期实验药物。【原文：Mirum Pharmaceuticals said on Monday it will acquire Bluejay Therapeutics in a deal worth up to $820 million, adding a late-stage experimental drug for a severe liver disease to its portfolio.】

item.title: 报告称中国去年向海外清洁技术投资 800 亿美元
item.description: 澳大利亚研究机构气候能源金融公司（CEF）的一份报告显示，中国企业在过去一年中承诺向海外投资约800亿美元用于清洁技术，因为它们要寻找新的市场来消化供应过剩。【原文：Chinese firms have committed some $80 billion in clean technology investments overseas over the past year as they sought new markets to absorb a supply glut, according to a report by Australian research group Climate Energy Finance (CEF).】

item.title: 媒体报道称，澳大利亚将与波音公司签订首批六架 "幽灵蝙蝠 "防务无人机合同
item.description: 据《悉尼先驱晨报》报道，澳大利亚预计将于周二宣布与澳大利亚波音公司签署一份价值 10 亿澳元（约合 6.633 亿美元）的合同，将 "幽灵蝙蝠 "空中无人机投入生产，首批购买六架这种协同作战飞机。【原文：Australia is expected to announce on Tuesday it will sign a A$1 billion ($663.30 million) contract with Boeing Australia to move the Ghost Bat air drone into production, buying an initial six of the collaborative combat aircraft, the Sydney Morning Herald reported.】

item.title: Recursion Pharma 的人工智能驱动疗法在罕见病试验中减少结肠增生
item.description: 利用人工智能发现新候选药物的 Recursion Pharma 公司周一表示，其实验性口服药物有助于减少一种罕见遗传病患者结肠中的异常增生。【原文：Recursion Pharma , which uses artificial intelligence to discover new drug candidates, said on Monday its experimental oral drug helped reduce abnormal growths in the colon in patients with a rare genetic condition.】

item.title: NextEra Energy 与谷歌云扩大交易，增加美国产能
item.description: NextEra Energy 公司周一表示，该公司已经扩大了与谷歌云的合作，将数据中心的容量提高了数千兆瓦，并在全美范围内推动能源基础设施的发展。【原文：NextEra Energy said on Monday it has expanded its partnership with Google Cloud to scale up data center capacity by multiple gigawatts and boost energy infrastructure across the U.S.】

item.title: 税务公司安达信在美国首次公开募股的目标估值为 17.5 亿美元
item.description: 税务咨询公司安达信集团周一表示，其在美国首次公开募股的目标估值最高可达 17.5 亿美元。【原文：Tax advisory firm Andersen Group said on Monday it was targeting a valuation of up to $1.75 billion in its initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 央行机构国际清算银行对黄金和股票双重泡沫表示担忧
item.description: 全球央行伞式机构国际清算银行（Bank for International Settlements）表示，黄金和股票价格同步飙升是至少半个世纪以来从未见过的现象，并引发了对两者潜在泡沫的质疑。【原文：The combination of gold and share prices soaring in unison is a phenomenon not seen in at least half a century and raises questions of a potential bubble in both, global central bank umbrella body, the Bank for International Settlements, says.】

item.title: 摩根大通任命伯克希尔公司的托德-康博斯（Todd Combs）领导新的投资计划
item.description: 摩根大通周一表示，伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）的投资经理托德-康博斯（Todd Combs）将担任该公司新的安全与弹性计划战略投资组组长。【原文：JPMorgan Chase said on Monday that Todd Combs, investment manager of Berkshire Hathaway , will head the strategic investment group of the firm's new security and resiliency initiative.】

item.title: 2025 年德国企业破产率将飙升至十年新高
item.description: 周一的一项新研究显示，由于德国正努力应对顽固的经济衰退，预计今年德国企业破产率将达到十多年来的最高水平。【原文：German corporate insolvencies are projected to hit their highest level in more than a decade this year, a new study revealed on Monday, as the nation grapples with a stubborn economic downturn.】

item.title: 投资者等待美联储降息决定，美国股指期货寸步难行
item.description: 周一，美国股指期货小幅走高，因为投资者认为美联储将在本周晚些时候举行期待已久的降息会议，而这次会议将是多年来分歧最大的会议之一。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were marginally higher on Monday, as investors priced in that the Federal Reserve will deliver a long-awaited rate cut later this week in a meeting that is shaping up to be one of the most divisive in years.】

item.title: 早间竞标美联储最后倒计时
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的关键所在。【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today.】

item.title: 欧盟要求 Meta 为个人 Facebook 和 Instagram 广告提供选择权
item.description: 欧盟委员会周一表示，Meta 承诺在个性化广告方面为欧盟的 Facebook 和 Instagram 用户提供选择，以符合欧盟的《数字市场法》。【原文：Meta has committed to giving Facebook and Instagram users in the European Union a choice when it comes to personalised ads, in line with the EU's Digital Markets Act, the European Commission said on Monday.】

item.title: 亨廷顿首席执行官称收购 Cadence 后将裁员
item.description: 亨廷顿银行首席执行官表示，亨廷顿银行在斥资 74 亿美元收购总部位于得克萨斯州的 Cadence 银行后，将裁减该银行的部分工作岗位，这将扩大这家俄亥俄州贷款机构在其认为最具吸引力的美国三大市场之一的影响力。【原文：Huntington Bancshares will cut some jobs at Texas-based Cadence Bank after its $7.4 billion acquisition, which expands the Ohio lender's presence in what it sees as one of the three most attractive U.S. markets, Huntington's chief executive said.】

item.title: 热潮过后，硅谷支持的防务公司面临成长的烦恼
item.description: 在过去的一年里，美国国防技术公司在五角大楼合同中所占的份额大约翻了一番，但在试图从炙手可热的初创公司发展成为能够大规模制造武器的重量级公司的过程中，它们面临着成长的烦恼。【原文：U.S. defense technology companies have roughly doubled their share of Pentagon contracts over the past year, but they face growing pains as they try to evolve from hot startups into heavyweights capable of building weapons at scale.】

item.title: 阿根廷铁路私有化梦想任重道远
item.description: 阿根廷是全球主要的粮食供应国，计划通过私有化和雄心勃勃的老化铁路网现代化改造，使其谷物和矿产出口实现超级增长，行业领袖表示，这将使远离港口地区的货运成本减半。【原文：Argentina, a major global food supplier, plans to supercharge its grain and mining exports with privatization and an ambitious modernization of its aging railway network, which industry leaders say will halve freight costs from regions far from ports.】
